subject: Politics
title: Defining Corruption
description: Learn Defining Corruption in one minute.

hook.text: A bribe is corruption. So is a senator trading votes for campaign donations. But where exactly is the line?

buildup.text: Corruption means abusing public power for private gain. It ranges from petty bribes to grand theft of state resources.

discovery.text: Transparency International's Corruption Perceptions Index ranks 180 countries. Denmark tops it; Somalia ranks last.

twist.text: Legal corruption is the hardest to fight. Lobbying, revolving doors, and campaign finance are legal but corrosive.

climax.text: Corruption isn't just theft. It destroys trust in institutions and makes citizens give up on their own government.

punchline.text: Corruption robs more than money. It steals public trust â€” and that's worse.
